revised_title: Mechanical Properties of Perfect Crystals: Ideal Strength and Anisotropy
tldr: The authors conducted computer calculations to determine the ideal strength and anisotropy of crystals of sodium chloride and argon. They used simple interatomic force models to analyze the deformation modes and found a marked anisotropy in the ideal tensile strength of sodium chloride, with a minimum on a specific plane. The ideal tensile strength of argon was less dependent on orientation, which aligns with the lack of a clear cleavage plane in the material.
